channel.title: No sprite folder in client folder
channel.description: guy ive been trying every tutorial for 3 weeks how the hell am i meant to change background without a sprite folder in my 317 pi client folder its unbelievably hard please im extremely desperate!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

item.title: No sprite folder in client folder
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

qeruina:

isn’t a great start for a new coder.

Yeah, neither is taking on a RSPS which is entirely wrote in Java, where the client is named random deobfuscated names, and the servers are filled with shit code and bad structure.

But people do it anyways.

Anyways OP: Your sprite is going to be in the cache, as you are using a 317 client, you should get Tom’s Cache Editor.

Then you need to open your cache in it, select the “View/Edit Image Archives”, and the background should be in one of those.
NOTE: If it has the original RS background, then it’s only half an image, the other half is the same image reversed (Using code within the client). If that’s the case, you replacing the image will show half of your background in a weird upside down state.

Read full topic
item.source: No sprite folder in client folder

item.title: No sprite folder in client folder
item.dc:creator: @qeruina qeruina
item.description:
@qeruina wrote:

hello there,

I know how annoying it is when you’re new to coding and people don’t wanna help with simple things.

Have you tried to download a cache editor? Search it on the internet. Also, if that doesn’t work, search another client. Having a packed in cache isn’t a great start for a new coder.

Qeruina

Read full topic
